channel.title: [PI] Invisible NPC Problem
channel.description:
Hey,
On my 317 PI base, some npc's appear invisible on screen however the yellow dots are visible on the minimap!
Screenshot:
[IMG]http://i1189.photobucket.com/albums/z428/shashank22/NPCInvisible.png[/img]
In the Picture above, the area that i am standing in, should have 4 Green Dragons.
They appear on the minimap but not on the floor. The problem also occurs with ghosts, a few types of skeletons and blue dragons.
Please need help urgently.

item.title: [PI] Invisible NPC Problem
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“Shame012, post:5, topic:436476”][quote author=Skiire link=topic=539186.msg3945826#msg3945826 date=1331850828]

Reload your models.

Wanna be tiny bit more specific on how to go about doing this?
Do i download new models from somewhere or do i have to do sum kinda reload coding bs

I’ve never personally loaded this higher revision garbage onto a 317 deob, but from what I’m seeing is the models you have are broken. This will require no programming what-so-ever, rather a new model. So, just update the ones that are broken with working ones. Check into your model header as well.
[/quote]

I need to know where i can get models and where i can check my model headers…

I am horrible at the cache part of rsps…[/quote]

Models are released all the time. Just cache pack them into the appropriate index using Tom’s Cache Suite. Model class would be my guess on where the model header would go.

Read full topic

This will require no programming what-so-ever, rather a new model. So, just update the ones that are broken with working ones. Check into your model header as well.[/quote]

item.title: [PI] Invisible NPC Problem
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“Shame012, post:3, topic:436476”][quote author=Skiire link=topic=539186.msg3945799#msg3945799 date=1331848235]
Reload your models.
[/quote]

Wanna be tiny bit more specific on how to go about doing this?
Do i download new models from somewhere or do i have to do sum kinda reload coding bs :P[/quote]

I’ve never personally loaded this higher revision garbage onto a 317 deob, but from what I’m seeing is the models you have are broken. This will require no programming what-so-ever, rather a new model. So, just update the ones that are broken with working ones. Check into your model header as well.

Read full topic
